snippet: The voters approved a revised constitution validating last summer’s military takeover and paving the way for Gen. Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi, the country’s top military leader, to seek the presidency.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry raises concerns about fairness of referendum on Egypt’s revised Constitution, which passed with 98.1 percent of vote.
lead_paragraph: The voters approved a revised constitution validating last summer’s military takeover and paving the way for Gen. Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi, the country’s top military leader, to seek the presidency.

headline.main: Overwhelming Vote for Egypt’s Constitution Raises Concern
headline.print_headline: Overwhelming Vote for Egypt’s Constitution Raises Concern
